speaker: IAGO
text_entry: SCENE II. A bedchamber in the castle: DESDEMONA in bed asleep;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: a light burning.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is the cause, it is the cause, my soul,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let me not name it to you, you chaste stars!--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is the cause. Yet I'll not shed her blood;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And smooth as monumental alabaster.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yet she must die, else she'll betray more men.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Put out the light, and then put out the light:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If I quench thee, thou flaming minister,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I can again thy former light restore,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should I repent me: but once put out thy light,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou cunning'st pattern of excelling nature,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I know not where is that Promethean heat

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That can thy light relume. When I have pluck'd the rose,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I cannot give it vital growth again.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It must needs wither: I'll smell it on the tree.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Kissing her

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ah balmy breath, that dost almost persuade

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Justice to break her sword! One more, one more.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Be thus when thou art dead, and I will kill thee,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And love thee after. One more, and this the last:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: So sweet was ne'er so fatal. I must weep,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But they are cruel tears: this sorrow's heavenly;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It strikes where it doth love. She wakes.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Who's there? Othello?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay. Desdemona.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Will you come to bed, my lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Have you pray'd to-night, Desdemona?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Ay, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If you bethink yourself of any crime

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Unreconciled as yet to heaven and grace,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Solicit for it straight.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, my lord, what do you mean by that?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Well, do it, and be brief; I will walk by:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I would not kill thy unprepared spirit;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: No; heaven forfend! I would not kill thy soul.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Talk you of killing?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, I do.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Then heaven

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Have mercy on me!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Amen, with all my heart!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If you say so, I hope you will not kill me.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hum!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And yet I fear you; for you are fatal then

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: When your eyes roll so: why I should fear I know not,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Since guiltiness I know not; but yet I feel I fear.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Think on thy sins.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: They are loves I bear to you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, and for that thou diest.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That death's unnatural that kills for loving.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, why gnaw you so your nether lip?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Some bloody passion shakes your very frame:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: These are portents; but yet I hope, I hope,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: They do not point on me.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Peace, and be still!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I will so. What's the matter?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That handkerchief which I so loved and gave thee

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou gavest to Cassio.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, by my life and soul!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Send for the man, and ask him.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Sweet soul, take heed,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Take heed of perjury; thou art on thy deathbed.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Ay, but not yet to die.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yes, presently:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Therefore confess thee freely of thy sin;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For to deny each article with oath

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Cannot remove nor choke the strong conception

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That I do groan withal. Thou art to die.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Then Lord have mercy on me!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I say, amen.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And have you mercy too! I never did

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Offend you in my life; never loved Cassio

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But with such general warranty of heaven

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As I might love: I never gave him token.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: By heaven, I saw my handkerchief in's hand.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O perjured woman! thou dost stone my heart,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And makest me call what I intend to do

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A murder, which I thought a sacrifice:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I saw the handkerchief.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He found it then;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I never gave it him: send for him hither;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Let him confess a truth.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He hath confess'd.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What, my lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That he hath used thee.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How? unlawfully?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He will not say so.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: No, his mouth is stopp'd;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Honest Iago hath ta'en order for't.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O! my fear interprets: what, is he dead?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Had all his hairs been lives, my great revenge

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Had stomach for them all.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas! he is betray'd and I undone.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Out, strumpet! weep'st thou for him to my face?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, banish me, my lord, but kill me not!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Down, strumpet!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Kill me to-morrow: let me live to-night!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nay, if you strive--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But half an hour!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Being done, there is no pause.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But while I say one prayer!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is too late.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He stifles her

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: [Within]  My lord , my lord! what, ho! my lord, my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What noise is this? Not dead? not yet quite dead?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I that am cruel am yet merciful;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I would not have thee linger in thy pain: So, so.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: [Within]  What, ho! my lord, my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Who's there?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: [Within]  O, good my lord, I would speak a word with you!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yes: 'tis Emilia. By and by. She's dead.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis like she comes to speak of Cassio's death.--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The noise was here. Ha! no more moving?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Still as the grave. Shall she come in? were't good?--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I think she stirs again:--no. What's best to do?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If she come in, she'll sure speak to my wife:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My wife! my wife! what wife? I have no wife.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O insupportable! O heavy hour!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Methinks it should be now a huge eclipse

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of sun and moon, and that the affrighted globe

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should yawn at alteration.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: [Within]  I do beseech you

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That I may speak with you, O, good my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I had forgot thee: O, come in, Emilia;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Soft; by and by. Let me the curtains draw.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Where art thou?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Unlocks the door

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What's the matter with thee now?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, my good lord, yonder's foul murders done!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What, now?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But now, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is the very error of the moon;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She comes more nearer earth than she was wont,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And makes men mad.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Cassio, my lord, hath kill'd a young Venetian

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Call'd Roderigo.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Roderigo kill'd!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And Cassio kill'd!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: No, Cassio is not kill'd.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not Cassio kill'd! then murder's out of tune,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And sweet revenge grows harsh.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, falsely, falsely murder'd!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, what cry is that?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That! what?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Out, and alas! that was my lady's voice.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Help! help, ho! help! O lady, speak again!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Sweet Desdemona! O sweet mistress, speak!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: A guiltless death I die.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, who hath done this deed?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nobody; I myself. Farewell

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Commend me to my kind lord: O, farewell!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Dies

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why, how should she be murder'd?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, who knows?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You heard her say herself, it was not I.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: She said so: I must needs report the truth.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She's, like a liar, gone to burning hell:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Twas I that kill'd her.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, the more angel she,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And you the blacker devil!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She turn'd to folly, and she was a whore.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Thou dost belie her, and thou art a devil.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She was false as water.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Thou art rash as fire, to say

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That she was false: O, she was heavenly true!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Cassio did top her; ask thy husband else.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, I were damn'd beneath all depth in hell,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But that I did proceed upon just grounds

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To this extremity. Thy husband knew it all.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: My husband!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thy husband.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That she was false to wedlock?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, with Cassio. Nay, had she been true,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If heaven would make me such another world

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of one entire and Perfect chrysolite,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'ld not have sold her for it.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: My husband!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, 'twas he that told me first:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: An honest man he is, and hates the slime

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That sticks on filthy deeds.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: My husband!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What needs this iteration, woman? I say thy husband.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O mistress, villany hath made mocks with love,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: My husband say that she was false!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He, woman;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I say thy husband: dost understand the word?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My friend, thy husband, honest, honest Iago.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: If he say so, may his pernicious soul

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Rot half a grain a day! he lies to the heart:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: She was too fond of her most filthy bargain.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Do thy worst:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: This deed of thine is no more worthy heaven

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Than thou wast worthy her.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Peace, you were best.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Thou hast not half that power to do me harm

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As I have to be hurt. O gull! O dolt!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As ignorant as dirt! thou hast done a deed--

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I care not for thy sword; I'll make thee known,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Though I lost twenty lives.--Help! help, ho! help!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: The Moor hath kill'd my mistress! Murder! murder!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Enter MONTANO, GRATIANO, IAGO, and others

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: What is the matter? How now, general!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, are you come, Iago? you have done well,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That men must lay their murders on your neck.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: What is the matter?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Disprove this villain, if thou be'st a man:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He says thou told'st him that his wife was false:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I know thou didst not, thou'rt not such a villain:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Speak, for my heart is full.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I told him what I thought, and told no more

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Than what he found himself was apt and true.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But did you ever tell him she was false?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I did.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: You told a lie, an odious, damned lie;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Upon my soul, a lie, a wicked lie.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: She false with Cassio!--did you say with Cassio?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With Cassio, mistress. Go to, charm your tongue.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I will not charm my tongue; I am bound to speak:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: My mistress here lies murder'd in her bed,--

speaker: All
text_entry: O heavens forfend!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And your reports have set the murder on.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nay, stare not, masters: it is true, indeed.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: 'Tis a strange truth.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: O monstrous act!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Villany, villany, villany!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I think upon't, I think: I smell't: O villany!--

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I thought so then:--I'll kill myself for grief:--

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O villany, villany!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What, are you mad? I charge you, get you home.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Good gentlemen, let me have leave to speak:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: 'Tis proper I obey him, but not now.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Perchance, Iago, I will ne'er go home.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O! O! O!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He falls on the bed

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Nay, lay thee down and roar;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For thou hast kill'd the sweetest innocent

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That e'er did lift up eye.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: [Rising]  O, she was foul!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I scarce did know you, uncle: there lies your niece,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Whose breath, indeed, these hands have newly stopp'd:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I know this act shows horrible and grim.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Poor Desdemona! I am glad thy father's dead:

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Thy match was mortal to him, and pure grief

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Shore his old thread in twain: did he live now,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: This sight would make him do a desperate turn,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Yea, curse his better angel from his side,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: And fall to reprobation.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis pitiful; but yet Iago knows

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That she with Cassio hath the act of shame

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A thousand times committed; Cassio confess'd it:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And she did gratify his amorous works

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With that recognizance and pledge of love

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Which I first gave her; I saw it in his hand:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It was a handkerchief, an antique token

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My father gave my mother.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O heaven! O heavenly powers!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Come, hold your peace.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: 'Twill out, 'twill out: I peace!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: No, I will speak as liberal as the north:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Let heaven and men and devils, let them all,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: All, all, cry shame against me, yet I'll speak.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Be wise, and get you home.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I will not.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: IAGO offers to stab EMILIA

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Fie!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Your sword upon a woman?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O thou dull Moor! that handkerchief thou speak'st of

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I found by fortune and did give my husband;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For often, with a solemn earnestness,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: More than indeed belong'd to such a trifle,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He begg'd of me to steal it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Villanous whore!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: She give it Cassio! no, alas! I found it,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And I did give't my husband.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Filth, thou liest!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: By heaven, I do not, I do not, gentlemen.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O murderous coxcomb! what should such a fool

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Do with so good a woman?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are there no stones in heaven

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But what serve for the thunder?--Precious villain!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He runs at IAGO  IAGO, from behind, stabs EMILIA, and exit

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: The woman falls; sure, he hath kill'd his wife.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Ay, ay: O, lay me by my mistress' side.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: He's gone, but his wife's kill'd.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: 'Tis a notorious villain. Take you this weapon,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Which I have here recover'd from the Moor:

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Come, guard the door without; let him not pass,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: But kill him rather. I'll after that same villain,

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: For 'tis a damned slave.

speaker: MONTANO
text_entry: Exeunt MONTANO and GRATIANO

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I am not valiant neither,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But ever puny whipster gets my sword:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But why should honour outlive honesty?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let it go all.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: What did thy song bode, lady?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Hark, canst thou hear me? I will play the swan.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And die in music.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Singing

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Willow, willow, willow,--

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Moor, she was chaste; she loved thee, cruel Moor;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: So come my soul to bliss, as I speak true;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: So speaking as I think, I die, I die.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Dies

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have another weapon in this chamber;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is a sword of Spain, the ice-brook's temper:--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, here it is. Uncle, I must come forth.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: [Within]  If thou attempt it, it will cost thee dear:

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Thou hast no weapon, and perforce must suffer.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Look in upon me then and speak with me,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or, naked as I am, I will assault thee.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Re-enter GRATIANO

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: What is the matter?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Behold, I have a weapon;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A better never did itself sustain

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Upon a soldier's thigh: I have seen the day,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That, with this little arm and this good sword,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have made my way through more impediments

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Than twenty times your stop: but, O vain boast!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Who can control his fate? 'tis not so now.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Be not afraid, though you do see me weapon'd;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Here is my journey's end, here is my butt,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And very sea-mark of my utmost sail.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Do you go back dismay'd? 'tis a lost fear;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Man but a rush against Othello's breast,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And he retires. Where should Othello go?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Now, how dost thou look now? O ill-starr'd wench!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Pale as thy smock! when we shall meet at compt,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: This look of thine will hurl my soul from heaven,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And fiends will snatch at it. Cold, cold, my girl!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Even like thy chastity. O cursed slave!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Whip me, ye devils,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: From the possession of this heavenly sight!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Blow me about in winds! roast me in sulphur!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Wash me in steep-down gulfs of liquid fire!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O Desdemona! Desdemona! dead!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Oh! Oh! Oh!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter LODOVICO. MONTANO, CASSIO carried in a chair, and Officers with IAGO, prisoner

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Where is this rash and most unfortunate man?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That's he that was Othello: here I am.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Where is that viper? bring the villain forth.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I look down towards his feet; but that's a fable.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If that thou best a devil, I cannot kill thee.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Wounds IAGO

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Wrench his sword from him.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I bleed, sir; but not kill'd.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I am not sorry neither: I'ld have thee live;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For, in my sense, 'tis happiness to die.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: O thou Othello, thou wert once so good,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Fall'n in the practise of a damned slave,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: What shall be said to thee?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why, any thing:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: An honourable murderer, if you will;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For nought I did in hate, but all in honour.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: This wretch hath part confess'd his villany:

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Did you and he consent in Cassio's death?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Dear general, I never gave you cause.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I do believe it, and I ask your pardon.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Will you, I pray, demand that demi-devil

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why he hath thus ensnared my soul and body?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Demand me nothing: what you know, you know:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: From this time forth I never will speak word.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: What, not to pray?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Torments will ope your lips.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Well, thou dost best.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Sir, you shall understand what hath befall'n,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Which, as I think, you know not. Here is a letter

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Found in the pocket of the slain Roderigo;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And here another: the one of them imports

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The death of Cassio to be undertook

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: By Roderigo.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O villain!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Most heathenish and most gross!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Now here's another discontented paper,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Found in his pocket too; and this, it seems,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Roderigo meant to have sent this damned villain;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: But that belike Iago in the interim

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Came in and satisfied him.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O the pernicious caitiff!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How came you, Cassio, by that handkerchief

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That was my wife's?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I found it in my chamber:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And he himself confess'd but even now

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That there he dropp'd it for a special purpose

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Which wrought to his desire.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O fool! fool! fool!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: There is besides in Roderigo's letter,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: How he upbraids Iago, that he made him

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Brave me upon the watch; whereon it came

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That I was cast: and even but now he spake,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: After long seeming dead, Iago hurt him,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Iago set him on.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: You must forsake this room, and go with us:

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Your power and your command is taken off,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And Cassio rules in Cyprus. For this slave,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: If there be any cunning cruelty

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: That can torment him much and hold him long,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: It shall be his. You shall close prisoner rest,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Till that the nature of your fault be known

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: To the Venetian state. Come, bring him away.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Soft you; a word or two before you go.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have done the state some service, and they know't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: No more of that. I pray you, in your letters,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: When you shall these unlucky deeds relate,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Speak of me as I am; nothing extenuate,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor set down aught in malice: then must you speak

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of one that loved not wisely but too well;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of one not easily jealous, but being wrought

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Perplex'd in the extreme; of one whose hand,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Like the base Indian, threw a pearl away

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Richer than all his tribe; of one whose subdued eyes,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Albeit unused to the melting mood,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Drop tears as fast as the Arabian trees

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Their medicinal gum. Set you down this;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And say besides, that in Aleppo once,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Where a malignant and a turban'd Turk

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Beat a Venetian and traduced the state,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I took by the throat the circumcised dog,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And smote him, thus.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Stabs himself

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: O bloody period!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: All that's spoke is marr'd.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I kiss'd thee ere I kill'd thee: no way but this;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Killing myself, to die upon a kiss.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Falls on the bed, and dies

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: This did I fear, but thought he had no weapon;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: For he was great of heart.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: [To IAGO]  O Spartan dog,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: More fell than anguish, hunger, or the sea!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Look on the tragic loading of this bed;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: This is thy work: the object poisons sight;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Let it be hid. Gratiano, keep the house,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And seize upon the fortunes of the Moor,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: For they succeed on you. To you, lord governor,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Remains the censure of this hellish villain;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The time, the place, the torture: O, enforce it!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Myself will straight aboard: and to the state

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: This heavy act with heavy heart relate.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Exeunt
